H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H6256.def: = a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time

H4279.def: = a reference to the day after the current day

H8111.def: = town; ◄ constructed by king {L:Omri<SDBH:עָמְרִי>}; ► capital of northern {L:Israelite<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>} kingdom until it was conquered by {L:Assyrians<SDBH:אַשּׁוּר>}; ≈ often used metonymically to refer to the entire northern kingdom

H5429.def: = unit of dry measure equivalent to 7.3 liters or 7 quarts; 3 seahs make up 1 {L:ephah<SDBH:אֵיפָה>}

H5560.def: = finely ground flour ◄ from only the inner kernel of the wheat, resulting in a high quality flour

H8255.def: = weight of approximately 11.5 grams, equals 20 {L:gerahs<SDBH:גֵּרָה>} and 2 {L:bekas<SDBH:בֶּקַע>}; 50 shekels make up 1 {L:mina<SDBH:מָנֶה>}; ► used for payment

H8184.def: = a type of cultivated grass like wheat or rice; less than 1 m tall; it produces a single head on each stalk, with rows of kernels; ◄ Hordeum distichum or Hordeum vulgare; ► its grain was used to make bread or beer, or for animal feed

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H8172.def: = state in which humans rest part of their body, such as their back or their arms, on an object that provides support, such as a tree or stick

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H6030.def: = action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H8064.def: = the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H702.def: = state in which a countable entity is four in number

H582.def: = human being; ◄ created by God; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality

H6607.def: literally: opening up of words; hence: = causative process by which deities make words easier to understand

H587.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse, including those associated to him or her

H3427.def: = action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

H6311.def: = a reference to the location of the speaker

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H5046.def: = causative action by which humans pass on information to others, usually by word of mouth

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H3318.def: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position

H962.def: = action by which someone takes all sorts of goods (including people and animals) by force from an enemy in war

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H4264.def: = open area where people are living in tents or other temporary dwellings for a limited amount of time and often for a specific purpose, such as nomads or soldiers

H758.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Shem<SDBH:שֵׁם>}; ► regarded as the founder of a land and ethnic group with the same name

H5429.def: = unit of dry measure equivalent to 7.3 liters or 7 quarts; 3 seahs make up 1 {L:ephah<SDBH:אֵיפָה>}

H5560.def: = finely ground flour ◄ from only the inner kernel of the wheat, resulting in a high quality flour

H8255.def: = weight of approximately 11.5 grams, equals 20 {L:gerahs<SDBH:גֵּרָה>} and 2 {L:bekas<SDBH:בֶּקַע>}; 50 shekels make up 1 {L:mina<SDBH:מָנֶה>}; ► used for payment

H8184.def: = a type of cultivated grass like wheat or rice; less than 1 m tall; it produces a single head on each stalk, with rows of kernels; ◄ Hordeum distichum or Hordeum vulgare; ► its grain was used to make bread or beer, or for animal feed

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H6485.def: = action by which humans or deities carefully observe a person, group, or object ► with the purpose of determining their well-being, condition, and/or integrity

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H8172.def: = state in which humans rest part of their body, such as their back or their arms, on an object that provides support, such as a tree or stick

H7429.def: = action by which humans, deities, or animals tread heavily and noisily on people, plants, or objects; ► usually with the purpose of killing, destroying, desecrating, and/or humiliating

H4191.def: = process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression

H1696.def: = causative action by which someone exterminates a group of people, either directly or by the hands of someone else

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H3381.def: = process by which objects move (involuntarily) from a place that is relatively high in elevation to a relatively lower place

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H1696.def: = causative action by which someone exterminates a group of people, either directly or by the hands of someone else

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H6256.def: = a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time

H4279.def: = a reference to the day after the current day

H8111.def: = town; ◄ constructed by king {L:Omri<SDBH:עָמְרִי>}; ► capital of northern {L:Israelite<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>} kingdom until it was conquered by {L:Assyrians<SDBH:אַשּׁוּר>}; ≈ often used metonymically to refer to the entire northern kingdom

H5429.def: = unit of dry measure equivalent to 7.3 liters or 7 quarts; 3 seahs make up 1 {L:ephah<SDBH:אֵיפָה>}

H8184.def: = a type of cultivated grass like wheat or rice; less than 1 m tall; it produces a single head on each stalk, with rows of kernels; ◄ Hordeum distichum or Hordeum vulgare; ► its grain was used to make bread or beer, or for animal feed

H8255.def: = weight of approximately 11.5 grams, equals 20 {L:gerahs<SDBH:גֵּרָה>} and 2 {L:bekas<SDBH:בֶּקַע>}; 50 shekels make up 1 {L:mina<SDBH:מָנֶה>}; ► used for payment

H5560.def: = finely ground flour ◄ from only the inner kernel of the wheat, resulting in a high quality flour

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H6030.def: = action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H8064.def: = the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H7429.def: = action by which humans, deities, or animals tread heavily and noisily on people, plants, or objects; ► usually with the purpose of killing, destroying, desecrating, and/or humiliating

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H4191.def: = process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression
